extensionDescription.message: Makes Opera wear a mask to look like Chrome to websites that otherwise won't work.
extensionDescription.description: The description of the extension shown in the add-on store.

maskStatusOn.message: The mask is on! I pretend to be Chrome on this site.
maskStatusOn.description: Status message in the popup when masking is active for the current site.

maskStatusOff.message: The mask is off. I appear as Opera for this site.
maskStatusOff.description: Status message in the popup when masking is inactive for the current site.

maskStatusUnsupported.message: The mask cannot work on this site.
maskStatusUnsupported.description: Status message in the popup for sites where the extension cannot run (e.g., chrome:// pages).

mainToggleDescription.message: May require a hard refresh (Ctrl+F5) to clear cached content and apply changes.
mainToggleDescription.description: A note in the popup explaining that a refresh might be needed.

manageSitesButton.description: Button text in the popup that opens the options page.

manageSitesFallback.message: To add or remove sites, please open the Extension Manager, select Chrome Mask for Opera, and hit Settings.
manageSitesFallback.description: Fallback text for when the options page cannot be opened directly.

linuxSpoofToggle.message: Spoof as Windows instead of Linux
linuxSpoofToggle.description: Label for the global Linux spoofing toggle in the popup.

linuxSpoofToggleDescription.message: Some sites block Linux browsers. Enable this to appear as Windows Chrome instead of Linux Chrome.
linuxSpoofToggleDescription.description: Explanation for the global Linux spoofing toggle.

managePlatformLinkText.description: Link text in the popup to open the options page for Linux-specific settings.

optionsPageTitle.description: The title of the options HTML page's browser tab.

optionsMainTitle.description: The main H2 title on the options page.

optionsMainDescription.message: For sites that don't work correctly in Opera, add them here to make them identify as Chrome.
optionsMainDescription.description: The primary paragraph explaining the main feature on the options page.

optionsInputPlaceholder.description: Placeholder text for the hostname input fields on the options page.

addSiteButton.description: Text for buttons that add a site to a list.

siteListRemoveButton.description: Text for buttons that remove a site from a list.

siteListEmpty.message: No sites are currently being masked.
siteListEmpty.description: Message shown when the main list of masked sites is empty on the options page.

linuxPlatformTitle.description: The H2 title for the Linux-specific section on the options page.

optionsLinuxSpoofTitle.description: The H3 sub-heading for the Linux spoofing feature on the options page.

optionsLinuxSpoofDescription.message: For any masked site, you can enable Windows spoofing to solve issues specific to Linux users (e.g., with video streaming services).
optionsLinuxSpoofDescription.description: The paragraph explaining the Linux spoofing feature on the options page.

optionsLinuxSpoofEmpty.message: No sites are configured for Windows spoofing.
optionsLinuxSpoofEmpty.description: Message shown when the Linux spoof list is empty on the options page.

optionsSpoofingAsWindows.description: Small text detail next to a hostname indicating it's spoofing as Windows.

addSiteErrorInvalid.message: Invalid hostname. Please enter a valid domain like 'example.com'
addSiteErrorInvalid.description: Error message for an invalid domain.

addSiteErrorAlreadyActive.message: This site is already in the masking list.
addSiteErrorAlreadyActive.description: Error message when trying to add a site that is already masked.

addSiteErrorAlreadySpoofing.message: This site is already in the Windows spoofing list.
addSiteErrorAlreadySpoofing.description: Error when trying to add a site that is already in the spoof list.

supportMessage.message: If this add-on has helped you, please consider $SUPPORT_LINK$ ☕
supportMessage.description: A message asking for support, likely in the popup.

breakageWarning.message: While Chrome Mask for Opera may help if you see a "Browser unsupported" message, it could cause unexpected breakage on some sites.
breakageWarning.description: A general warning about potential side effects.

reportBrokenSite.message: If you find a site which works better with Chrome Mask for Opera enabled, please report it $WEBCOMPAT$. Thank you! ♥
reportBrokenSite.description: A message asking users to report sites.

inProductReporterLinkText.description: Link text for a specific reporting method.

webcompatLinkText.description: Link text for the WebCompat website.
